means: 隐退，使与世隔绝( cloister的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: the cloistered world of the university
She cloistered herself in the office.
sentence.Network_cn: 她呆在办公室里好像与世隔绝一样.

sentence.Network_en: Nash did not live a cloistered existence nor was he spared the shocks that flesh is heir to.
sentence.Network_cn: 纳什并非过着与世隔绝的生活,他同样也不能逃脱人生难免的种种打击.

entry.def: If you have a cloistered way of life, you live quietly and are not involved in the normal busy life of the world around you.

means.word_mean: 1. of communal life sequestered from the world under religious vows

sentences.sentence: "sat close together in the sequestered pergola"
"sitting under the reclusive calm of a shade tree"

auth_sentence.content: Little cloistered nooks, quiet places where lovers go to sit.
auth_sentence.res_content: Little cloistered nooks, quiet places where lovers go to sit.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Little cloistered nooks, quiet places where lovers go to sit.

auth_sentence.content: Nick Clegg is clearly au fait with the somewhat cloistered world of international diplomacy.
auth_sentence.res_content: Nick Clegg is clearly au fait with the somewhat cloistered world of international diplomacy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Nick Clegg is clearly au fait with the somewhat cloistered world of international diplomacy.

auth_sentence.content: It was a cloistered existence, where older courtesans often settled petty rivalries and couples' disputes.
auth_sentence.res_content: It was a cloistered existence, where older courtesans often settled petty rivalries and couples' disputes.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It was a cloistered existence, where older courtesans often settled petty rivalries and couples' disputes.

sentences.en: Nash did not live a cloistered existence nor was he spared the shocks that flesh is heir to.
sentences.cn: 纳什并非过着与世隔绝的生活，他同样也不能逃脱人生难免的种种打击。
